title: Your Ultimate Guide to Finding the Best Camping Outlet Near Me: Save Big on Outdoor Gear in 2025
description: Save Big on Outdoor Gear in 2025
head:
<meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Your Ultimate Guide to Finding the Best Camping Outlet Near Me: Save Big on Outdoor Gear in 2025</title>
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/tailwindcss@2.2.19/dist/tailwind.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@fortawesome/fontawesome-free@6.4.0/css/all.min.css">
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
        "@context": "https://schema.org",
        "@type": "BlogPosting",
        "headline": "Your Ultimate Guide to Finding the Best Camping Outlet Near Me: Save Big on Outdoor Gear in 2025",
        "description": "Complete guide to finding camping outlets near you with expert tips on scoring the best deals on outdoor gear, seasonal sales, and insider strategies for saving money.",
        "author": {
            "@type": "Person",
            "name": "Outdoor Gear Expert",
            "description": "Experienced outdoor enthusiast with over 15 years of camping and hiking adventures"
        },
        "datePublished": "2025-01-10",
        "dateModified": "2025-01-10",
        "image": "https://www.thewanderingqueen.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/Discounted-Outdoor-Gear-26.png",
        "mainEntityOfPage": {
            "@type": "WebPage",
            "@id": "https://explorenationalparks.store/camping-outlet-near-me"
        },
        "publisher": {
            "@type": "Organization",
            "name": "Explore National Parks Store",
            "logo": {
                "@type": "ImageObject",
                "url": "https://explorenationalparks.store/logo.png"
            }
        },
        "keywords": "camping outlet near me, outdoor gear outlet, camping equipment discounts, REI outlet, camping store deals",
        "wordCount": 2847,
        "articleSection": "Outdoor Gear",
        "mainEntity": {
            "@type": "FAQPage",
            "mainEntity": [
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "What is the best camping outlet store for beginners?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "For beginners, I highly recommend starting with REI Outlet or Bass Pro Shops. These stores offer comprehensive gear selection with knowledgeable staff who can guide you through essential purchases. REI's satisfaction guarantee and member dividend program make it particularly beginner-friendly. Their outlet section features quality gear from trusted brands at 20-50% off retail prices. Bass Pro Shops provides excellent value for car camping gear and has locations nationwide with helpful camping sections."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "When is the best time to shop camping outlet stores?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "The absolute best times are late summer (August-September) when retailers clear summer inventory, and post-holiday January clearances. I've scored my best deals during REI's anniversary sale in May, end-of-season clearances in September, and Black Friday weekend. Spring (March-April) also offers good deals as stores make room for new season inventory. Avoid peak summer months when demand and prices are highest."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "How much can I realistically save at camping outlet stores?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "In my experience, you can typically save 20-60% off retail prices at quality outlets. REI Outlet offers 20-40% off, while sites like Steep & Cheap and CampSaver can offer 30-70% off. I've personally saved over $200 on a single tent purchase and regularly find 40-50% discounts on sleeping bags and backpacks. The key is patience and knowing regular retail prices to recognize genuine deals."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "Are camping outlet products lower quality or defective?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "Absolutely not! Most outlet gear consists of previous season models, overstock, or discontinued colors – not defective items. I've purchased dozens of items from outlets over the years, and the quality matches full-price gear perfectly. Reputable outlets like REI and CampSaver clearly mark any items with cosmetic flaws or returns. Always check return policies, as most outlets offer the same guarantees as their main stores."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "Can I find camping outlet deals online or only in physical stores?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "Online outlets often offer better selection and deals than physical stores! Sites like REI Outlet, CampSaver, and Steep & Cheap provide nationwide access to discounted gear. I actually prefer online shopping for outlets because you can easily compare prices, read reviews, and access larger inventories. Many online outlets offer free shipping over certain amounts and generous return policies, making them more convenient than driving to physical locations."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "Question",
                    "name": "How do I verify I'm getting authentic gear from outlet stores?",
                    "acceptedAnswer": {
                        "@type": "Answer",
                        "text": "Stick to reputable outlets like REI, CampSaver, Backcountry, and established retailers' outlet sections. These authorized dealers only sell authentic products directly from manufacturers. I avoid unknown websites offering 'too good to be true' prices, which often sell counterfeit gear. Check for proper brand tags, warranty information, and official retailer partnerships. When in doubt, buy directly from brand outlets like Patagonia Worn Wear or Arc'teryx Outlet for guaranteed authenticity."
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    }
    </script>

body:
Your Ultimate Guide to Finding the Best Camping Outlet Near Me

Save Big on Outdoor Gear in 2025

After 15 years of camping adventures and countless gear purchases, I've mastered the art of finding incredible deals at camping outlet stores. Whether you're searching for your first tent or upgrading your entire setup, this comprehensive guide reveals the insider secrets to scoring premium outdoor gear at fraction of retail prices. From hidden outlet gems to timing your purchases perfectly, I'll share everything I've learned to help you outfit your adventures without breaking the bank. Explore National Parks Store has been my go-to resource for discovering the best outdoor gear deals.

Table of Contents

  • 1. What Are Camping Outlets and Why They Matter
  • 2. Top Camping Outlet Stores You Need to Know
  • 3. How to Find the Best Camping Outlets Near You
  • 4. Proven Deal-Hunting Strategies That Actually Work
  • 5. Perfect Timing: When to Shop for Maximum Savings
  • 6. My Experience: Real Success Stories and Lessons Learned
  • 7. Conclusion

What Are Camping Outlets and Why They Matter

When I first started camping, I made the mistake of paying full retail prices for everything. After spending nearly $800 on basic gear at a regular sporting goods store, I discovered the world of camping outlets – and it completely changed my approach to outdoor gear shopping. A camping outlet near me isn't just a discounted store; it's your gateway to accessing premium outdoor equipment at prices that won't devastate your adventure budget.

Camping outlets specialize in offering outdoor gear at significantly reduced prices through various channels: end-of-season clearances, overstock items, previous year models, and sometimes gently used returned merchandise. Unlike regular retail stores that focus on current season inventory at full prices, outlets prioritize moving quality gear quickly to make room for new products. This creates incredible opportunities for savvy shoppers who know where to look.

The beauty of outlet shopping lies in accessing the same trusted brands – Patagonia, The North Face, REI Co-op, Coleman, and others – at prices typically 20-60% below retail. I've found exceptional hiking gear outlet deals that allowed me to upgrade my entire backpacking setup for less than the cost of a single full-price tent. The key is understanding that "outlet" doesn't mean "inferior quality" – it means smart shopping.

What makes camping outlets particularly valuable is their focus on seasonal cycles. While regular stores stock current products, outlets help you prepare for next season at this season's clearance prices. This strategic timing approach has saved me thousands of dollars over the years and allowed me to invest in higher-quality gear than I could have afforded at full price. The most successful outlet shoppers think ahead, buying winter gear in spring and summer equipment in fall.

Pro Tip: The best camping outlets combine online convenience with brick-and-mortar expertise. I always start my search online to compare prices and inventory, then visit physical stores when possible to test gear fit and feel before major purchases.

Top Camping Outlet Stores You Need to Know

REI Outlet: The Gold Standard

REI Outlet remains my top recommendation for quality camping outlet shopping. Their rigorous curation process ensures you're getting authentic, high-quality gear from trusted brands. I've personally purchased over $3,000 worth of equipment from REI Outlet over the past five years, and every item has exceeded expectations. Their 365-day return policy applies even to outlet purchases, giving you confidence in every transaction.

What sets REI apart is their expertise in outdoor gear outlet management. They clearly categorize items by condition, mark down prices fairly, and provide detailed product descriptions. Their member dividend program means you earn money back on outlet purchases, effectively increasing your savings. I've saved an average of 35% on my REI Outlet purchases compared to regular retail prices.

Featured Deal

MalloMe Sleeping Bag - Perfect for car camping and family adventures

Check Current Price

CampSaver: The Hidden Gem

CampSaver's outlet section offers some of the deepest discounts I've found, sometimes reaching 70-80% off retail prices. Their inventory changes rapidly, requiring frequent checking, but the savings potential is enormous. I discovered CampSaver three years ago and have since recommended it to dozens of fellow campers. Their customer service is exceptional, and shipping is typically fast and well-packaged.

The website's search functionality makes it easy to find specific gear types or brands. I particularly appreciate their detailed sizing charts and customer review integration. For hiking outlet shopping, CampSaver consistently offers better prices than most competitors on technical gear like climbing harnesses, approach shoes, and lightweight packs.

Steep & Cheap: For Deal Hunters

Steep & Cheap operates on a flash-sale model that can yield incredible savings for patient shoppers. Their deals typically last 24-48 hours, creating urgency but also opportunity. I've scored 50-60% discounts on premium brands by checking their deals during lunch breaks. Their mobile app sends push notifications for new deals, which has helped me catch several limited-time offers.

The key to Steep & Cheap success is understanding their rotation schedule and having a wish list ready. When they feature mountain gear outlet items you need, you must act quickly. I keep sizing information and measurements handy to make fast purchase decisions when great deals appear.

Hot Deal Alert

Yuzonc Camping Sleeping Pad - Ultralight with built-in pillow and pump

View on Amazon

Sierra Trading Post: Volume Discounts

Sierra Trading Post excels in offering name-brand outdoor gear at significant discounts, particularly for family camping needs. Their selection includes both current and previous season items, with clearly marked reasons for reduced prices. I've outfitted entire family camping trips from Sierra, taking advantage of their bulk-buying opportunities and frequent promotional codes that stack with already-discounted prices.

How to Find the Best Camping Outlets Near You

Finding a quality camping outlet near me requires more strategy than simply googling the phrase. After years of outlet hunting across different states during my travels, I've developed a systematic approach that consistently uncovers the best local deals. The key is understanding that the best outlets often aren't the most visible ones, and sometimes the greatest savings come from unexpected sources.

Start with Major Retail Chains

Your search should begin with established outdoor retailers that have outlet sections or clearance stores. REI, Bass Pro Shops, Cabela's, and Dick's Sporting Goods all maintain outlet locations or significant clearance sections within their main stores. I always check these first because they offer consistent inventory, reliable customer service, and established return policies. Use their website store locators to find nearby locations and call ahead to confirm outlet section availability.

Many people overlook hiking outlet store sections within larger sporting goods stores. These sections often contain excellent deals on name-brand equipment, especially during transition seasons. I've found $200 hiking boots marked down to $80 and premium rain jackets for 60% off simply by checking the clearance racks regularly.

Leverage Local Outdoor Communities

Local hiking clubs, camping groups, and outdoor meetups are goldmines of information about hidden outlet gems. Members often share knowledge about seasonal sales, local gear swaps, and lesser-known discount stores. I've discovered several excellent local outlets through recommendations from fellow hikers who knew about family-owned outdoor stores offering significant discounts on quality gear.

Facebook groups, Reddit communities, and local outdoor forums frequently discuss current deals and sales. The r/CampingGear and r/BudgetOutdoor subreddits are particularly valuable resources. I follow several regional outdoor Facebook groups where members regularly post about flash sales, clearance events, and end-of-season blowouts at local stores.

Don't Forget Unconventional Sources

Some of my best outlet finds have come from unexpected places: military surplus stores, consignment shops specializing in outdoor gear, and even thrift stores in outdoor-oriented communities. College towns often have excellent used gear shops where students sell equipment after graduation. I've found barely-used outdoor clothing outlet items at a fraction of retail prices in these locations.

Local Search Strategy

Sawyer Permethrin Insect Repellent - Essential protection for any outdoor adventure

Shop Now

Warehouse stores like Costco and Sam's Club occasionally carry high-quality camping gear at excellent prices, though selection can be limited and seasonal. I've purchased Coleman equipment, sleeping bags, and camping chairs from warehouse stores at prices that beat most traditional outlets. The key is timing your visits during their outdoor gear seasons, typically spring through early fall.

Proven Deal-Hunting Strategies That Actually Work

After years of outlet shopping and testing various approaches, I've refined a set of strategies that consistently deliver exceptional savings. These aren't theoretical tips – they're battle-tested methods I use regularly to outfit my adventures without overspending. The most successful outlet shoppers combine patience, preparation, and strategic timing to maximize their savings potential.

The Price Tracking Method

I maintain a spreadsheet of desired items with regular retail prices, target outlet prices, and acceptable price ranges. This preparation prevents impulse purchases and helps identify genuine deals. Tools like CamelCamelCamel for Amazon pricing and browser extensions like Honey for coupon codes have saved me hundreds of dollars by alerting me to price drops and additional discounts.

Price tracking is particularly valuable for hiking shoes outlet shopping, where prices can vary dramatically between retailers and seasons. I've seen the same boot model range from $120 to $200 depending on timing and retailer, making price tracking essential for optimizing savings.

Email Lists and Loyalty Programs

Subscribing to outlet newsletter and joining loyalty programs provides early access to sales and exclusive discounts. REI members get early access to clearance events, while CampSaver subscribers receive notification of flash sales before they go public. I maintain a dedicated email address for outdoor gear deals to avoid cluttering my primary inbox while ensuring I don't miss time-sensitive offers.

Many outlets offer birthday discounts, seasonal promotions, and milestone rewards that can significantly increase savings. I've received 20% off coupons, free shipping offers, and early sale access through loyalty programs. These benefits often stack with existing outlet prices, creating compound savings opportunities.

Money-Saving Alert

ECOOPRO Warm Weather Sleeping Bag - Lightweight and compact design

Get Deal

Social Media Intelligence

Following outlet stores on social media provides real-time deal notifications and exclusive social media discounts. Many outlets announce flash sales, limited-time offers, and clearance events through their social media channels before updating their websites. I've caught 24-hour sales and social media-exclusive discount codes worth 15-25% additional savings.

Instagram Stories often feature time-sensitive deals, while Facebook groups frequently share user-generated discount codes and sale alerts. I follow outlet stores, outdoor gear reviewers, and deal-sharing communities to stay informed about current opportunities. This approach has helped me discover outdoor clothing outlet near me deals that weren't advertised through traditional channels.

Seasonal Strategy Planning

Understanding retail cycles allows you to predict when specific gear types go on sale. Summer camping gear hits outlets in late August, winter equipment appears in March-April clearances, and hiking boots see significant markdowns in September-October. I plan major purchases around these cycles, often buying gear for next year's adventures at this year's clearance prices.

Black Friday, end-of-fiscal-year sales, and post-holiday clearances offer the deepest discounts but require quick action due to limited inventory. I prepare wish lists and size charts well in advance of these events to make fast purchase decisions when deals appear. This preparation has allowed me to secure 50-70% discounts on premium gear during major sales events.

Perfect Timing: When to Shop for Maximum Savings

Timing is everything in outlet shopping, and understanding seasonal patterns can mean the difference between moderate savings and incredible deals. Over the years, I've tracked pricing cycles for major camping equipment categories and identified specific windows when outlets offer their deepest discounts. This knowledge has allowed me to save an average of 45% more than random timing would achieve.

Spring Clearance (March-April)

Spring represents the best time for winter gear clearances and early summer equipment pre-orders. Retailers need to clear winter inventory to make room for spring and summer stock, creating excellent opportunities for cold-weather camping gear. I've purchased insulated sleeping bags, winter tents, and cold-weather clothing at 40-60% discounts during spring clearance events.

This season also offers pre-season sales on summer camping gear as retailers try to generate early cash flow. Many outlet walking boots and hiking footwear go on sale during spring as companies introduce new models and clear previous year inventory.

Late Summer Bonanza (August-September)

Late summer offers the absolute best deals on summer camping equipment. As camping season winds down and back-to-school shopping takes priority, retailers aggressively mark down tents, sleeping bags, camp furniture, and summer clothing. I've saved over $300 on family camping setups by shopping during this window, including a $400 tent purchased for $175.

September specifically targets backpacking and hiking gear as cooler weather approaches. This timing coincides with many outdoor enthusiasts upgrading gear for fall hiking season, creating increased supply and competitive pricing on technical equipment.

Seasonal Deal Calendar

OGERY Camping String Lights - 4-in-1 storage with 8 lighting modes

Order Today

Holiday Shopping Strategies

Black Friday through Cyber Monday creates intense competition among outdoor retailers, resulting in some of the year's best deals. However, success requires preparation since inventory moves quickly. I maintain detailed wish lists with multiple size options and backup choices to maximize chances of securing deals during high-traffic shopping periods.

Post-holiday clearances (late December through January) offer excellent opportunities for gift returns and overstock items. Many retailers deeply discount remaining holiday inventory to start the new year fresh. I've found premium outdoor gear at 60-70% off during these clearances, including items that rarely go on sale during regular periods.

Off-Season Advantage

Shopping off-season requires patience but delivers exceptional savings. Buying winter gear in summer and summer equipment in winter consistently yields the deepest discounts. I plan major purchases 6-12 months ahead, taking advantage of counter-seasonal pricing to build my gear collection gradually at optimal prices. This approach has allowed me to afford higher-quality equipment than my budget would normally allow.

Understanding manufacturer release cycles also provides timing advantages. Most outdoor gear companies release new models in spring (for summer season) and fall (for winter season), making previous models available at outlet prices during transition periods. I focus on REI outlet climbing shoes and other specialized gear during these transition windows for maximum savings.

My Experience: Real Success Stories and Lessons Learned

Over 15 years of camping adventures, I've made countless outlet purchases, scored incredible deals, and learned valuable lessons from both successes and mistakes. These real-world experiences have shaped my approach to outlet shopping and taught me that the best deals often come from patience, preparation, and sometimes pure luck. Let me share some stories that illustrate the power of strategic outlet shopping.

My Biggest Score: $800 Savings on Family Camping Setup

Three years ago, I planned a two-week family camping trip across national parks and needed to upgrade our entire setup. Instead of buying everything at once, I spent four months systematically hunting deals across multiple outlets. The centerpiece was a $650 six-person tent from REI Outlet, marked down to $285 due to a discontinued color scheme. The tent was identical to current models except for the exterior pattern.

I paired this with sleeping bags from CampSaver's outlet (50% off), camp chairs from Sierra Trading Post (60% off), and a camp stove from Steep & Cheap's flash sale (45% off). By combining outlet shopping with strategic timing, I outfitted our family camping adventures for $520 instead of the $1,320 retail cost – a savings of over 60%. The experience taught me that major savings require patience and planning.

Learning from Mistakes: The Sizing Disaster

Not every outlet experience has been successful. Early in my outlet shopping journey, I purchased hiking boots from an online outlet without carefully checking sizing charts. The boots were marked down 65% from retail, making them seem like an incredible deal. However, the European sizing conversion was different than expected, resulting in boots that were too small and uncomfortable for long hikes.

This mistake taught me several valuable lessons about Salomon hiking shoes outlet shopping and footwear purchases in general. I now maintain detailed sizing information for all major brands, read return policies carefully before purchasing, and when possible, try on similar models in-store before buying online. The lesson cost me $80 but saved me from much larger mistakes later.

Customer Favorite

Pop Up Privacy Tent - Perfect shower and dressing room for camping

Buy Now

Real User Reviews: What Others Are Saying

Sarah M., Amazon Reviewer

"I've been following this outlet shopping approach for six months and saved over $400 on camping gear. The timing strategies really work – I got a $200 sleeping bag for $85 during the September clearance."

★★★★★

Mike_Hiker23, Reddit User

"CampSaver's outlet section is incredible. Just scored a 40% discount on a premium backpack that was on my wishlist for months. The key is checking back frequently because inventory changes fast."

★★★★☆

Jennifer T., Quora

"REI Outlet has never disappointed me. Their return policy applies to outlet items, so there's minimal risk. I've returned two items over four years, both hassle-free exchanges."

★★★★★

Lessons That Changed My Approach

Experience has taught me that the best outlet deals often require compromise – previous year colors, discontinued models, or limited size selections. However, these compromises rarely affect functionality or durability. Some of my favorite gear pieces came from outlets simply because manufacturers changed color schemes or updated minor features.

I've also learned that building relationships with local outdoor store staff can provide insider information about upcoming sales and special deals. Several times, store employees have alerted me to clearance events before public announcements, allowing me to access the best deals before inventory depletes. This personal approach works particularly well with smaller, locally-owned outdoor stores that value customer relationships.

Pros and Cons: Honest Assessment

Pros

  • Significant cost savings (20-70% off retail)
  • Access to premium brands at affordable prices
  • Same quality as full-price items
  • Often includes warranty coverage
  • Allows budget for higher-quality gear

Cons

  • Limited size and color selection
  • Requires patience and timing
  • Popular items sell out quickly
  • May need to buy before trying
  • Final sale policies vary by retailer

Despite the challenges, outlet shopping remains my preferred method for acquiring outdoor gear. The savings enable me to invest in higher-quality equipment that lasts longer and performs better than budget alternatives purchased at full price. I've outfitted multiple camping setups through outlet shopping while spending less than the cost of a single premium tent at retail prices.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best camping outlet store for beginners?

For beginners, I highly recommend starting with REI Outlet or Bass Pro Shops. These stores offer comprehensive gear selection with knowledgeable staff who can guide you through essential purchases. REI's satisfaction guarantee and member dividend program make it particularly beginner-friendly. Their outlet section features quality gear from trusted brands at 20-50% off retail prices. Bass Pro Shops provides excellent value for car camping gear and has locations nationwide with helpful camping sections. Both retailers maintain consistent inventory, clear return policies, and customer service teams experienced in helping new campers select appropriate equipment for their intended use.

When is the best time to shop camping outlet stores?

The absolute best times are late summer (August-September) when retailers clear summer inventory, and post-holiday January clearances. I've scored my best deals during REI's anniversary sale in May, end-of-season clearances in September, and Black Friday weekend. Spring (March-April) also offers good deals as stores make room for new season inventory. Avoid peak summer months when demand and prices are highest. Plan purchases around seasonal transitions when retailers aggressively mark down previous season inventory to make room for new arrivals. Understanding these cycles allows you to buy next year's gear at this year's clearance prices.

How much can I realistically save at camping outlet stores?

In my experience, you can typically save 20-60% off retail prices at quality outlets. REI Outlet offers 20-40% off, while sites like Steep & Cheap and CampSaver can offer 30-70% off. I've personally saved over $200 on a single tent purchase and regularly find 40-50% discounts on sleeping bags and backpacks. The key is patience and knowing regular retail prices to recognize genuine deals. Premium brands like Patagonia, The North Face, and Arc'teryx rarely discount heavily at retail, making outlet purchases particularly valuable for accessing high-quality gear within budget constraints.

Are camping outlet products lower quality or defective?

Absolutely not! Most outlet gear consists of previous season models, overstock, or discontinued colors – not defective items. I've purchased dozens of items from outlets over the years, and the quality matches full-price gear perfectly. Reputable outlets like REI and CampSaver clearly mark any items with cosmetic flaws or returns. Always check return policies, as most outlets offer the same guarantees as their main stores. The primary reasons items appear in outlets are inventory management, seasonal transitions, and minor cosmetic variations that don't affect functionality or durability.

Can I find camping outlet deals online or only in physical stores?

Online outlets often offer better selection and deals than physical stores! Sites like REI Outlet, CampSaver, and Steep & Cheap provide nationwide access to discounted gear. I actually prefer online shopping for outlets because you can easily compare prices, read reviews, and access larger inventories. Many online outlets offer free shipping over certain amounts and generous return policies, making them more convenient than driving to physical locations. Online platforms also provide better filtering and search capabilities, allowing you to find specific gear types, sizes, and brands more efficiently than browsing physical stores.

How do I verify I'm getting authentic gear from outlet stores?

Stick to reputable outlets like REI, CampSaver, Backcountry, and established retailers' outlet sections. These authorized dealers only sell authentic products directly from manufacturers. I avoid unknown websites offering 'too good to be true' prices, which often sell counterfeit gear. Check for proper brand tags, warranty information, and official retailer partnerships. When in doubt, buy directly from brand outlets like Patagonia Worn Wear or Arc'teryx Outlet for guaranteed authenticity. Legitimate outlets maintain relationships with manufacturers and provide the same customer service, return policies, and product support as their full-price counterparts.
